description: Improving existing code structure, readability, performance, or maintainability
principles: Refactoring should improve code quality without changing behavior
Changes should be clear and well-justified
Refactored code should be simpler and easier to understand
Testing should verify behavior remains unchanged
Incremental changes are better than massive rewrites

input: Clear description of what needs improvement
Why this refactoring is needed (readability, performance, maintainability)
Any constraints or dependencies to consider

qualityCriteria.completeness: Refactoring addresses all mentioned issues, results in cohesive improvement
qualityCriteria.correctness: Behavior unchanged, no bugs introduced, existing tests still pass
qualityCriteria.consistency: Refactored code follows same patterns as rest of codebase
qualityCriteria.performance: Performance improved or at least not degraded, improvements justified
qualityCriteria.clarity: Code is simpler and more readable, reasoning is clear
qualityCriteria.maintainability: Future changes to this code will be easier, code is more extensible

commonPatterns: Extract repeated code into reusable functions
Break large functions into smaller ones
Clarify complex logic with comments or simplification
antiPatterns: Making code more complex while claiming improvement
Refactoring without understanding the code first
